pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:5.1: 8. The training rule on disposing of feces
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.2: At that time a brahmin who had earned money through his services to the king thought, “I will ask for my wages.” After washing his head, he walked past the nuns’ dwelling place on his way to the king’s residence.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.3: Just then, after defecating in a pot, a nun disposed of the feces over a wall, and it landed on the head of that brahmin.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.4: He then complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.5: “They are not ascetics these unchaste, shaven-headed ones.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.6: How can they throw the contents of a feces-pot on my head?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.7: I will burn down their dwelling place!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.8: And he got hold of a firebrand and entered the dwelling place.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.9: Just then a lay follower who was coming out from the nuns’ dwelling place saw that brahmin with a firebrand on his way in,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.11: “Sir, why are you entering the nuns’ dwelling place with a firebrand?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.12: “These unchaste, shaven-headed ones threw the contents of a feces-pot on my head.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.13: I will burn down their dwelling place!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.15: You’ll get your wages and a thousand coins in addition.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:6.16: That brahmin then washed his head, went to the king’s residence, and he got his wages and a thousand coins in addition.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:7.1: Then that lay follower returned to the nuns’ dwelling place, told the nuns what had happened, and he scolded them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:7.2: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:7.4: “How can nuns dispose of feces over a wall?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:7.5: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:7.8: “How can nuns dispose of feces over a wall?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:7.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:7.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:8.1: ‘If a nun disposes of feces or urine or rubbish or food scraps over a wall or over an encircling walls, or she gets someone else to dispose of it, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:14.2: there are three kinds of encircling walls: encircling walls made of bricks, encircling walls made of stone, encircling walls made of wood.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:17.2: if she asks another, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:17.3: If she only asks once, then even if the other disposes many times, she commits one offense entailing confession.
